intro: Lesquerella argyraea, commonly known as silverleaf lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are silvery-gray, giving it its common name, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Lesquerella argyraea is of interest for its potential in biofuel and industrial applications due to its oil-rich seeds.
